messages.message: Did anyone here help with adding the hugo-theme-learn as submodule in the instabase-docs repo? I think I need to get the actual code in there versus keeping it as a submodule because I need to upgrade jquery to 3.6.0 (from 3.3.1), and I'm wondering if there's any reason for me not to do that (besides the obvious that it's easier to manage as a submodule :disappointed: )

submodules are not very release friendly (updating them would involve code change so it could be a nightmare to keep things in sync)

this looks like only needed during installation phase, can we package it and put it somewhere, then reference the url in our code and expand it in our installation script?

So you're saying that it's better to not have submodules? We currently are using one here in the docs: https://github.com/instabase/instabase-docs/tree/master/themes

That would be great if we could do it an alternative way, if we can just modify the couple of places we need to to bump the jquery version. @Heymian do you have any input here since I think you helped with initial setup?

yeah i also am pretty strongly against git submodule. it’s only ever resulted in a bunch of messed up git state and builds every time i’ve used it, so would definitely prefer to avoid making every developer here deal with it.
we tucked the submodule for docs into the docker image so at least all of us don’t have to deal with it locally every time we build webapp.
~can you help me understand how the docs repo ties into jquery? is it a hugo dependency? can we just bump it up in docs?~  Edit: i understand
feel free to pull the dependency into instabase-docs and remove the submodule. that won’t impact the mono repo at all if i’m remembering the build setup correctly.
My experience with sub modules has also been quite bad. Would not recommend
